org.apache.ambari.server.security.encryption

Class AbstractCredentialStore

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.ambari.server.security.encryption.AbstractCredentialStore
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CredentialStore
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    FileBasedCredentialStore, InMemoryCredentialStore

    public abstract class AbstractCredentialStore
extends Object
implements CredentialStore
    AbstractCredentialStore is an abstract implementation of CredentialStore that loads and stores @{link KeyStore} data. Implementations of this class, provide the input and output streams used to read and write the data.

    • Method Detail

      • addCredential

        public void addCredential(String alias,
                          Credential credential)
                   throws org.apache.ambari.server.AmbariException
        Adds a new credential to this CredentialStore

        The supplied key will be converted into UTF-8 bytes before being stored.

        This implementation is thread-safe, allowing one thread at a time to access the credential store.

        Specified by:
        addCredential in interface CredentialStore
        Parameters:
        alias - a string declaring the alias (or name) of the credential
        credential - the credential to store
        Throws:
        org.apache.ambari.server.AmbariException - if an error occurs while storing the new credential

        Retrieves the specified credential from this CredentialStore

        This implementation is thread-safe, allowing one thread at a time to access the credential store.

        Returns:

      • loadKeyStore

        protected KeyStore loadKeyStore(InputStream inputStream,
                                String keyStoreType)
                         throws org.apache.ambari.server.AmbariException
        Loads a KeyStore from an InputStream

        Implementations are expected to call this to load the relevant KeyStore data from the InputStream of some storage facility.

        Parameters:
        inputStream - the InputStream to read the data from
        keyStoreType - the type of key store data expected
        Returns:
        a new KeyStore instance with the loaded data
        Throws:
        org.apache.ambari.server.AmbariException - if an error occurs while loading the key store data from the InputStream

      • writeKeyStore

        protected void writeKeyStore(KeyStore keyStore,
                             OutputStream outputStream)
                      throws org.apache.ambari.server.AmbariException
        Writes a KeyStore to an OutputStream

        Implementations are expected to call this to write the relevant KeyStore data to the OutputStream of some storage facility.

        Parameters:
        keyStore - the KeyStore to write
        outputStream - the OutputStream to write the data into
        Throws:
        org.apache.ambari.server.AmbariException - if an error occurs while writing the key store data

      • toBytes

        protected byte[] toBytes(char[] chars)
        Converts an array of characters to an array of bytes by encoding each character into UTF-8 bytes.

        An attempt is made to clear out sensitive data by filling any buffers with 0's

        Parameters:
        chars - the array of chars to convert
        Returns:
        an array of bytes, or null if the original array was null

      • toChars

        protected char[] toChars(byte[] bytes)
        Converts an array of bytes to an array of character by decoding the bytes using the UTF-8 character set.

        An attempt is made to clear out sensitive data by filling any buffers with 0's

        Parameters:
        bytes - the array of bytes to convert
        Returns:
        an array of chars, or null if the original array was null
